page.title: 04Transport
page.content: The main through-link is the A10 - London to Cambridge.Part of this is dual carriageway but most is single carriageway.It carries a very large volume of traffic in and out of the London area especially during the early morning and evening rush hours.A by-pass is planned within the next few years for Colliers End and other villages on the A10.This will relieve the traffic conjestion and cut down car pollution to residential areas. Conflicting interests in land use are certain to arise.The small settlements which have sprung up along the A10 feed off passing trade and are focal points for the stimulation of local industry.The main rural settlements are connected by twisty minor roads both to each other and the A10.
